TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DetailsViewRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
type DetailsViewRowCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class for its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property contains only the data rows. To access the header row, footer row, top pager row, and bottom pager row, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.HeaderRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.FooterRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.TopPagerRow%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.BottomPagerRow%2A> properties, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class supports several ways to access the items in the collection:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an array, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The value of each row is then displayed on the page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollection/CS/detailsviewrowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollection/VB/detailsviewrowcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.

Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this object to the specified object, starting at the specified index in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified array, starting at the specified index. The array can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based array for the `array` parameter.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object to an array. The array is then iterated through and the value of each row is displayed on the page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo/CS/detailsviewrowcollectioncopytocs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo/VB/detailsviewrowcollectioncopytovb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the object.
Docs.value: The number of items in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of items in the collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object contains any items before iterating through the collection.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollection/CS/detailsviewrowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollection/VB/detailsviewrowcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
abstract member GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator override this.GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that contains all objects in the object.
Docs.returns: An -implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property is undefined.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that contains the items from the collection. The enumerator is then iterated through and the value of each row is displayed on the page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator/CS/detailsviewrowcollectiongetenumeratorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator/VB/detailsviewrowcollectiongetenumeratorvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the object can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false`, to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is synchronized (thread safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is thread safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is not thread safe.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: A that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection. The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object itself.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.System%23Collections%23ICollection%23CopyTo%28System.Array%2CSystem.Int32%29> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index. The <xref:System.Array> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array> object for the `array` parameter.
